root: ^Maxwell Fairbeard, a tall man wearing a fancy suit, bowler hat, and pocket watch, walks into the tavern with swagger, eventually taking his seat.
^Maxwell. Maxwell Fairbeard. But you can call me Max. And who's this lovely lady with whom I have the pleasure of speaking...?
^Oh, it's Steele, Naomi Steele. I just inherited this place from my dad.
^Ah, so you're the long-lost daughter Old Man Steele spoke so much about!
^My dad... really spoke of me that much?
^Sure did, sweetheart. And I can see why, too. You really are quite lovely!

^Oh! Where are my manners? I do beg your pardon, Ms. Steele. I have certain... habits I've formed while liaising with the fairer sex. It's almost a reflex, you see. I should know to afford my old friend's daughter more respect than that.
^Very well, Max. May I get you anything?
^You certainly may! Nothing like some good ole’ Kentucky Fried Salisbury Steak to clear overhang from a jin-soaked night, wouldn't you agree?
^Can't say I'd know anything about that. But I'll get your steak to you right away.
^Oh! Sorry, old habits again. Forget I said anything! Anyway, I appreciate it, Darling... er, I mean, thank you, Ms. Steele.
^Naomi walks away from the table, peeved.
